attributes.action: Stop housing asylum seekers in hotels and stop benefits to  economic migrants
attributes.additional_details: The refugee crisis is getting worse as more and more asylum seekers and economic migrants risk their lives to come to the UK. We ask the government to make coming to the UK less attractive by stopping benefits being payed to suspected economic migrants, we also ask that all asylum seekers be housed in basic accommodation  instead of hotels as this costs the British tax payers  millions of pounds per day.
attributes.background: We ask  the government to stop housing asylum seekers in hotels and to stop paying benefits to suspected  economic migrants.

rejection.details:
We have published the following petition, which you might like to sign:

Stop housing asylum seekers who entered the UK illegally in hotels: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/628324

Asylum seekers – i.e. persons waiting for a decision on an asylum application – are not entitled to mainstream social security benefits.
